column4: yo guys, when i do locate 'foo' it says locate not found, where is updatedb located?
its a new installation of ubuntu
returns nothing, i guess updatedb isn't installed either
do i need to apt-get locate?
/usr/bin/updatedb is just a sym link to it
so i should change my updatedb symlink now from /etc/alternatives/updatedb to /usr/bin/updatedb.mlocate right?
it lets you choose an alternative for similar apps like which mail server to use or ftp server by default
ah okay nice, thanks,  i set my default to mlocate now
do i need to do mlocate then or will locate use mlocate
locate should now be a sym link to mlocate, that's the whole idea of update-alternatives
ah okay yeah, so /usr/bin/locate is a symlink to /etc/alternatives/locate which is a symlink to /usr/bin/mlocate
